page.title: 20SURVEY OF PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: The survey and photography of this area has been carried out by five members of the Bosham Women's Institute, founded in 1921 as part of the National Federation of Women's Institutes, whose purpose is to enable women in rural areas to meet and work together in craft and cultural activities. At the monthly meetings there is a speaker on some subject of general interest, or an entertainment, followed by tea, to enable members to meet their friends. Bosham W.I. undertook this survey because of the link between Bosham on the coast and Buckfold, north of the Downs. For at least 400 years, until the 1920s they shared the same Lord of the Manor. The five W.I. members who worked on the Survey were Angela Bromley-Martin, Peggy Cook, Aylmer Gick, Carol Hall and Irene Marwood.
